Kelly Ernswiler.Action: Kisses his dog tags grimly before stepping into danger, signaling personal resolve and seriousness.
Walks openly toward enemy soldiers without aiming his weapon, seemingly accepting death.
Does not fire at German officer despite being at point-blank range and having the opportunity.
Does not struggle when captured; keeps a sarcastic, defiant attitude toward captors, including provocative remarks.
Tells the German officer 'My mother and I don't have that kind of relationship' indicating honesty but emotional distance.
Refuses to beg for his life when ordered by his captor, demonstrating defiance rather than submission or appeal for mercy.
Laughs after being slapped by the German officer, asserts the officer is against the rules, shows a lighthearted attitude despite danger.
Engages in a sarcastic exchange with the GI and German officer, maintains composure and humor in tense situation.
Accepts Bart Bowland's handshake and introduces himself with openness.
Keeps calm and makes witty remarks during a tense war simulation scene.
Observes the situation and coordinates nonverbally with the GI to facilitate an ambush.
